page.title: 07CARTERTON MARKET
page.content: The Thursday market in{Carterton }is a very busy place,people rush from stall to stall trying to get good bargains. THe stall holders are mainly English but quite a few are of Pakistani and Indian origin. They travel hundreds of miles during the week to markets in distant{Bristol,Nottingham}&{Leicester and more locally in{Finmere}. There are stalls which sell a variety of foods such as meat,cheese,fish,fruit & vegetables.Other stalls sell material, clothes,shoes and even larger items ' like cookers, refrigerators & carpets. Some stalls specialize in selling only small items & everything on the stall costs only 50 pence. Demonstrations can be seen & lots of people crowd around to watch.There is usually an ice_cream van & others selling hot dogs,beefburgers & chips.You can have a complete meal while you shop.
